articles.author: Hannah Confino
articles.description: Israel's ambulance service has stocked blood supplies in a fortified underground centre, factories have moved out hazardous materials and municipal authorities are checking bomb shelters and water supplies as the country waits for a threatened attack from Iran and its proxies.
articles.title: Tense Israel in waiting as attack threat looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kyiv kept up air attacks on Russia's Kursk border region on Wednesday, with defence systems destroying four drones overnight, the Russian defence ministry said, a day after Moscow accused Ukraine of targeting the area with an armoured assault.
articles.title: Russia's defence ministry says Ukraine keeps up air attacks on Kursk

articles.author: Joanna Plucinska
articles.description: Egypt instructed all of its airlines to avoid Iranian air space for a three-hour period in the early morning on Thursday amid tension between Israel and Iran.
articles.title: Egypt asks its airlines to avoid Iran air space for three hours on Thursday

articles.author: Kate Holton, Catarina Demony, Suban Abdulla
articles.description: British police braced for further violent racist attacks against Muslims and immigration centres on Wednesday evening, with the government pledging swift action to punish anyone stoking disorder.
articles.title: British police brace for fresh riots as Starmer promises swift action

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris will campaign alongside her new running mate, Tim Walz, on Wednesday, holding events in battleground states Wisconsin and Michigan that will offer an early test of his Midwestern credentials.
articles.title: Harris and Walz to campaign in crucial Michigan and Wisconsin

articles.author: Ruma Paul, Sudipto Ganguly
articles.description: Bangladesh's protest leaders said they expect members of an interim government, led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, to be finalised on Wednesday after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina quit and fled to India following a violent crackdown on a student-led uprising.
articles.title: Bangladesh students expect interim government members to be finalised on Wednesday

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin, Josh Smith
articles.description: South Korea could rupture its U.S. alliance and shock financial markets if it started building nuclear weapons, Defence Minister Shin Won-sik told Reuters, dismissing renewed domestic calls for the country's own arsenal to deter North Korea.
articles.title: Exclusive: South Korean nuclear weapons would fracture US ties, defence chief says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taylor Swift's three concerts in Vienna this week were cancelled after government confirmation of a planned attack at the stadium, the organizer said late on Wednesday.
articles.title: Taylor Swift Vienna concerts cancelled due to planned attack, organizer says

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: Israel should fully investigate allegations of sexual abuse against Palestinian detainees by its soldiers, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said on Wednesday, calling for "zero tolerance" for perpetrators.
articles.title: Israel should have 'zero tolerance' if soldiers sexually assaulted Palestinian prisoners, says US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain saw almost 2,000 antisemitic incidents in the first half of 2024, a record figure for the first six months of any year, a Jewish advisory body said on Thursday.
articles.title: UK records record level of antisemitism in first half of year, charity says
